content:
It's good that you donated to a project that depends on user support to continue to develop the product. But it wasn't necessary, and any mention you see about donations is merely a suggestion, not a requirement. You don't need to donate in order to download, install, or use Thunderbird. It is a free product.

Are you sure you downloaded it from the official source, and not some illegitimate or malicious site?

https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/

content:
OK, I have absolutely NO idea why that happens, but I'll offer some suggestions to try. Maybe one will work.

  1. restart in troubleshoot mode and see if it works. If so, then it may be an addon that is interfering
  2. remove the delete button from tool bar, shut thunderbird down and restart and then add the delete button back and see if that works
  3. reboot the PC.... (probably a useless gesture, but I list it anyway)

Unified folders are not true folders, only virtual. Good luck.
creator: davidsk

creator: Tombarkas

content:
Are you talking about the correct toolbar ?

You cannot customise the 'Menu Bar' toolbar. It has the following items - File, Edit, View, Go, Message ,Events and Tasks, Tools, Help

If you select a Message then you can use 'Edit' > 'Delete Message'

Are you talking about the 'Unified Toolbar' ?

  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/unified-toolbar

By default it contains the 'Global Search', but you can customise it to add some additional options. 'Delete' is an option you can add to the 'Unified Toolbar'. Please confirm you are talking about the Unified toolbar.

Other methods of deleting:

  • Select/open message so you can see it in the Message Pane. Click on the 'Delete' button which is auto available in the Message Header area.
  • Right click on email in Message List and click on the Delete/Trash icon top right.
  • Enable the column header called 'Delete' - it puts a trash bin icon on each email line - click on it to delete email.
  • Select email in Message List - press the keyboard 'del' key


Q: What version of thunderbird are you currently using ? Q: How many accounts? Are they all imap or all pop or a mix of both ?

I presume you have several mail accounts as you mention using 'Unified Inbox' - so you have enabled:

  • 'View' > 'Folders' > 'Unified Folders'

Q: Does the 'Delete' button on 'Unified Toolbar' work correctly if you switch off the 'Unified Folders' option and just use the 'All Folders' option ?

Q: What addon extensions are you using - if any ?

  • In Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • Scroll all the way down to the 'Add-ons' section

Copy all the contents in that are and paste the data into this forum question OR take a screenshot and upload the image.


I'm needing to know some info because I want to perform some tests and that means I've got to set up my view the same as yours.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

content: The error message indicates that your email provider is rejecting the password. Many email providers (such as gmail and outlook) now require a unique password when using an email client. If you share the domain used for your email account, someone here may have suggestions. If this is your first use of the account in Thunderbird, it may also be due to error in the setup. Posting a screenshot of the incoming server settings pane may also prove helpful. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: In that case, something happened. An update? You didn't mention any error messages. are you seeing messages from your online account If thunderbird was working and now it is not, then something other than thunderbird is the problem.

content:
Innanzitutto ringrazio per la rapida risposta.

Riguardo a quello che è successo... Credo che ci siamo passati, se non tutti, sicuramente un grossa percentuale di noi utenti della posta elettronica.

In pratica, ho inviato un allegato Word a un amico tramite Thunderbird. Poi ci siamo sentiti e abbiamo concordato telefonicamente delle modifiche all'allegato, che io ho fatto al volo senza salvare prima l'allegato in un nuovo documento. Quindi, alla chiusura dello stesso, le modifiche sono andate perdute.

La mia domanda riguardava la possibilità che esista da qualche una sorta di file temporaneo con le modifiche fatte (in Word, tra i file non salvati, non l'ho trovato).

Cordiali saluti.
creator: orazio.celentano

content:
Non credo di aver capito bene... nel senso ho capito quel che dici ma non vedo il legame con Thunderbird. A meno che tu non abbia aperto l'allegato direttamente da dentro Thunderbird.

I file allegati aperti direttamente da Thunderbird vengono temporaneamente copiati in una cartella temporanea. In Windows 10 ad esempio questa cartella è del tipo

C:\Users\NOME_UTENTE\AppData\Local\Temp\NOME_CASUALE.tmp\ContainedTemp

Tuttavia il contenuto di questa cartella viene cancellato quando si chiude Thunderbird per cui è improbabile che il file sia ancora presente.

content: My suggestion was that the URL I shared may help you find out what you are doing that is causing the problem. It may not be anything you are doing; possibly, you are sharing a web server with the same IP address as a spammer. there are many websites with information on how to remove a block; writing to Thunderbird is not the way. Thunderbird is just your messenger. You need to actively pursue this, as other domains may also block you. Contacting Google for support is also a possibility. Good luck.
creator: davidsk

content: Hi David, thank you for that reply. That is really interesting and helpful. I had assumed it was a setting on Thunderbird, but clearly not. Thanks again.
creator: sales323

content: There might be something in the format of your messages that is triggering the gmail spam filters, but not those of other services. Besides the factors mentioned in the blog link, try sending a plain text message with no signature or attachments or links. If it's still not received by gmail users, the blocking is probably related to the authentication of your domain, not anything to do with message format.

content:
There are several ways, but since you have the profile, try this: - ln thunderbird, click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - exit thunderbird - you are now in the profile. to replace 100% of the profile with your copied profile, just delete everything in this folder, then open your backedup profile and paste here. your old profile in entirety is now here. restart thunderbird and all should be there.

The above isn't needed, since you did a partiai transfer, but I include it in case that approach may still be valid. For your sent messages, I assume this is a POP account, since it would be irrelevant for an IMAP account. I suggest copying the sent folder but do not copy the msf and delete the msf is there is one. I say this as that might corrupt the indexing of the folder. Also, in placing the sent folder, it should overlay the existing sent folder. Let me know if I am misunderstanding the situation.
creator: davidsk

content: Segui questa guida -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/creare-utilizzare-lista-distribuzione-thundebird
creator: @next

content:
If you're comfortable with windows file explorer, it's easy - exit thunderbird on old computer - copy two files: abook.sqlite and history.sqlite from within profile - on new computer, with thunderbird not running, paste the two into profile, overwriting the default.

to find active profile, click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll to 'profile folder', click 'open folder', and then exit thunderbird. that places you into the profile.
creator: davidsk
